document_data.name: Myrcrest
document_data.text: The bird nodded again, as graciously as a courtier. Then it spread wide its wings, and I ducked at the sudden movement, although the feathers were yards away from my face. It leapt to the window, and then through it, so that its blackness seemed sucked up by the night. Its exit was so abrupt that at first I could hardly believe it had been there at all.
document_data.mainbody: Myrcrest was intelligent, but could only communicate via raven-like squawking and head bobs.
document_data.Description: Although resembling a [[raven]], Myrcrest was much larger, being about 50% wider and longer in the wings than a regular specimen. Its feet were pale and fleshy and ended in {{SIAdj|3|inch|c|long=yes|adj=long}} talons, and its eyes glowed or reflected greenish-yellow light. Stranger still, its feathers had no sheen, instead seeming dull and even absorbing light. It could be quite intimidating to those unused to it.

Myrcrest was intelligent, but could only communicate via raven-like squawking and head bobs.
document_data.Activities: Myrcrest delivered messages for Vangerdahast. These it carried in a thick leather pouch tied around its neck.
document_data.History: On the evening of [[Eleint 18]] in the {{yearlinkName|1367}}, Myrcrest carried a vital message from Vangerdahast concerning the fate of the killer of the king's envoy [[Grodoveth]] to retired [[War Wizard]] [[Benelaius]] at his [[Benelaius's_cottage|cottage]]. He and [[Lindavar]] received it well, but [[Jasper (servant)|Jasper]] was frightened of it.
